title: Evidence mounts that an eye scan may detect early Alzheimer's disease

title_detail.value: Evidence mounts that an eye scan may detect early Alzheimer's disease

summary: Results from two studies show that a new, non-invasive imaging device can see signs of Alzheimer's disease in a matter of seconds. The researchers show that the small blood vessels in the retina at the back of the eye are altered in patients with Alzheimer's.

summary_detail.value: Results from two studies show that a new, non-invasive imaging device can see signs of Alzheimer's disease in a matter of seconds. The researchers show that the small blood vessels in the retina at the back of the eye are altered in patients with Alzheimer's.
